com.motorola.mod

Class ModManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.motorola.mod.ModManager

  • public class ModManager
extends Object
    A class which provides the interface to talk to the Moto Mod Manager Service. App should call bindService with an intent w/ action ModManager.ACTION_BIND_MANAGER, the app will also need to have the permission ModManager.PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO in order to bind to it.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ACTION_BIND_MANAGER
      Action to be used to bind to the Moto Mod Manager Service.
      static String ACTION_MOD_ATTACH
      A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is attached to the device.
      static String ACTION_MOD_ATTACH_FAILED
      A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is attached to the device but the attach failed, due to an incorrect manifest or other attach failure.
      static String ACTION_MOD_CAPABILITY_CHANGED
      A broadcast action which is sent when the capability of the Moto Mod has been changed, this is used for asynchronous messaging between a Moto Mod and a device, and typically used by a Moto Mod to reflects changes which degrades one of its capability (such as the Moto Mod battery getting low, or the Moto Mod thermal treshold being reached).
      static String ACTION_MOD_DETACH
      A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is detached from the device.
      static String ACTION_MOD_ENUMERATION_DONE
      A broadcast action sent when the phone has finished enumerating all the functionalities of a Moto Mod.
      static String ACTION_MOD_ERROR
      A broadcast action which is sent when an error happened to the device, i.e., communication error
      static String ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_DONE
      A broadcast action sent when the firmware update of the Moto Mod firmware completed.
      static String ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_START
      A broadcast action sent when the device starts firmware update on an attached Moto Mod.
      static String ACTION_MOD_REQUEST_FIRMWARE
      A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is being attached to the device but but is unable to boot due to missing or invalid firmware, and request userspace to give the firmware.
      static String EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE
      Intent Extra.
      static String EXTRA_MOD_ERROR
      Extras for ModManager.ACTION_MOD_ERROR, the value include: ModManager.MOD_ERROR_SHORT_DETECTED, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_SHORT_RECOVERY_FAIL, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_FAILED, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_ATTEMPT, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_SUCCESS, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_COMMUNICATION_RESET.

      This function returns the list of ModInterfaceDelegation corresponding to the Linux devices on the Moto Mod that support a particular protocol.

      Returns the list of attached Moto Mods.

      Returns the list of attached Moto Mods.

      This function returns the SDK version supported by the Phone's core platform.
      static int getModSdkVersion(Context context)
      This function returns the SDK version supported by the ModService that is installed on the phone, independently of your device core Moto Mod Platform version.
      boolean initSetupComplete(ModDevice device)
      If the Moto Mod specifies a package name in its manifest file and if that package is installed on the smartphone, the ModManager will not display the initial setup screens, but will let the app handle it.
      static int isModServicesAvailable(Context context)
      Verifies that the Moto Mod service is installed and enabled on this device, and that the version installed on this device is compatible with the one required by this application (is not older than the one required by the calling application).

      • PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO

        public static final String PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO
        The permission which protects access to Moto Mod device information, the protection level of this permission is normal.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_MOD_INTERNAL

        public static final String PERMISSION_MOD_INTERNAL
        The permission which protects the management of Moto Mod device. The protection level of this permission is signatureOrSystem, and is not available to third party applications.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PERMISSION_USE_RAW_PROTOCOL

        public static final String PERMISSION_USE_RAW_PROTOCOL
        The permission which protects access to the RAW interface of a Moto Mod. The protection level of this permission is dangerous.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_BIND_MANAGER

        public static final String ACTION_BIND_MANAGER
        Action to be used to bind to the Moto Mod Manager Service.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_ATTACH

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_ATTACH
        A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is attached to the device.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT and ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_DETACH

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_DETACH
        A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is detached from the device.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID and ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID and ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_ENUMERATION_DONE

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_ENUMERATION_DONE
        A broadcast action sent when the phone has finished enumerating all the functionalities of a Moto Mod. This intent will only be sent once all the functionalities advertised by the Moto Mod in its hardware manifest have a corresponding ModConnection instance. This also means the phone has finished initialization of the Moto Mod.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT and ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_START

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_START
        A broadcast action sent when the device starts firmware update on an attached Moto Mod.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_DONE

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_DONE
        A broadcast action sent when the firmware update of the Moto Mod firmware completed.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_RESULT_CODE and ModManager.EXTRA_REASON.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_ATTACH_FAILED

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_ATTACH_FAILED
        A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is attached to the device but the attach failed, due to an incorrect manifest or other attach failure.

        Extras include ModManager.EXTRA_RESULT_CODE, which is an error code defined in android.os.OsConstant, and ModManager.EXTRA_VENDOR_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID, ModManager.EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_REQUEST_FIRMWARE

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_REQUEST_FIRMWARE
        A broadcast action which is sent when a Moto Mod is being attached to the device but but is unable to boot due to missing or invalid firmware, and request userspace to give the firmware.

        The extras of this intent is ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE; receiver of this intent requires to have permission ModManager.PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_CAPABILITY_CHANGED

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_CAPABILITY_CHANGED
        A broadcast action which is sent when the capability of the Moto Mod has been changed, this is used for asynchronous messaging between a Moto Mod and a device, and typically used by a Moto Mod to reflects changes which degrades one of its capability (such as the Moto Mod battery getting low, or the Moto Mod thermal treshold being reached).

        After receiving this intent, an appication can Use the API ModDevice.getCapabilityLevel(), ModDevice.getCapabilityReason() or ModDevice.getCapabilityVendor() to query the detailed changes; the extras includes ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ACTION_MOD_ERROR

        public static final String ACTION_MOD_ERROR
        A broadcast action which is sent when an error happened to the device, i.e., communication error

        The extra includes ModManager.EXTRA_MOD_ERROR; receiver of this intent is required to have permission ModManager.PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Constant Field Values

      • SUCCESS

        public static final int SUCCESS
        This is a status code returned for the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) will return ModManager.SUCCESS when the device supports Moto Mod and minimum Moto Mod platform version required by your application is supported on the target device. This means the Moto ModService is there and compatible with this device.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_MISSING

        public static final int SERVICE_MISSING
        This is a status code returned by the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) will return ModManager.SERVICE_MISSING when the device on which your application does not support the Moto Mod interface.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_UPDATING

        public static final int SERVICE_UPDATING
        This is a status code returned by the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) will return ModManager.SERVICE_UPDATING when the device supports Moto Mod but the Moto ModManager service is being updated.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED

        public static final int SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED
        This is a status code returned by the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) will return ModManager.SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED when the device supports Moto Mod, but it needs to be updated; the client app should prompt the user to update the ModService in order to continue to use this App.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_DISABLED

        public static final int SERVICE_DISABLED
        This is a status code returned by the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). When ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) returns ModManager.SERVICE_DISABLED, then Moto ModService is available on the target device, but currently disabled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SERVICE_INVALID

        public static final int SERVICE_INVALID
        This is a status code returned by the ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context). ModManager.isModServicesAvailable(android.content.Context) will return ModManager.SERVICE_INVALID when the device on which your application is running does not support the Moto Mod interface.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MOD_SERVICE_NAME

        public static final ComponentName MOD_SERVICE_NAME
        The instance of ComponentName, which can be set in the intent ModManager.ACTION_BIND_MANAGER to bind to the Moto Mod Service.

      • EXTRA_VENDOR_ID

        public static final String EXTRA_VENDOR_ID
        Intent Extra. This value returns the vendor ID of the attached Moto Mod (a 32bit value), read from the attached Moto Mod hardware manifest.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID

        public static final String EXTRA_PRODUCT_ID
        Intent Extra. This value returns the product ID of the attached Moto Mod (a 32bit value), read from the attached Moto Mod hardware manifest.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID

        public static final String EXTRA_UNIQUE_ID
        Intent Extra which returns the Unique ID of a Moto Mod. The Unique ID is read from the Moto Mod hardware and uniquely identifies the Moto Mod. The format of this value might differ based on the underlying Moto Mod hardware, on first generation Moto Mods it is a 128 bit value (16 bytes). example: 00000000203934545232500C00060858
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_VENDOR

        public static final String EXTRA_VENDOR
        Intent Extra. This value returns the Vendor name of the attached Moto Mod, read from the attached Moto Mod hardware manifest, as a String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_PRODUCT

        public static final String EXTRA_PRODUCT
        Intent Extra. This value returns the Product name of the attached Moto Mod, read from the attached Moto Mod hardware manifest, as a String.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_RESULT_CODE

        public static final String EXTRA_RESULT_CODE
        Intent Extra. This value returns the result code of a greybus event. For example, a request to flash firmware, 0 means success, any other value means failure. refer to android.system.OsConstants, as this function returns the same error codes.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_REASON

        public static final String EXTRA_REASON
        Intent Extra. This value returns a readable and descriptive string of the ModManager.EXTRA_RESULT_CODE.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_PROTOCOLS

        public static final String EXTRA_PROTOCOLS
        Intent Extra. This value returns the list of protocols supported by a Moto Mod. This returns an instance of ArrayList, where the Integer corresponds the int value of ModProtocol.Protocol
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE

        public static final String EXTRA_MOD_DEVICE
        Intent Extra. This value indicates the ModDevice corresponding to the attached Moto Mod.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • EXTRA_MOD_ERROR

        public static final String EXTRA_MOD_ERROR
        Extras for ModManager.ACTION_MOD_ERROR, the value include: ModManager.MOD_ERROR_SHORT_DETECTED, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_SHORT_RECOVERY_FAIL, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_FAILED, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_ATTEMPT, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_RECOVERY_SUCCESS, ModManager.MOD_ERROR_COMMUNICATION_RESET.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PACKAGE_SCHEME

        public static final String PACKAGE_SCHEME
        A Moto Mod can indicate, in its hardware manifest, its associated optional Android application. PACKAGE_SCHEME defines the scheme for a string associated with the Moto Mod. This string represents a URL to a Android package. An application can call ModManager.getDefaultModPackage(com.motorola.mod.ModDevice) to retrieve this package name or URI.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ModManager

        public ModManager(Context context,
          IModManager manager)
        Constructor for ModManager, the instance of IModManager can be retrieved from bindService(new Intent(ModManager.ACTION_BIND_MANAGER).setComponent( ModManager.MOD_SERVICE_NAME), ...);
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - If your target SDK version is lower than Android API level 23 (6.0)

    • Method Detail

      • registerModListener

        public boolean registerModListener(ModListener listener,
                          int[] protocols)
        Register a callback function which will be called when a Moto Mod is attached or detached from a device.
        Parameters:
        listener - - the callback
        protocols - - This is an array of protocol IDs, that this listener wants to get notified when a Moto Mod with these specified protocols is attached/detached. The IDs are int value of the Protocol, or use the constant value ModProtocol.PROTOCOL_ALL to be notified of changes for all protocols. A null value will unregister this listener.
        Returns:
        true: register/unregister successfully

      • getModList

        public List getModList(boolean onlineOnly)
                throws RemoteException
        Returns the list of attached Moto Mods. Calling this function with TRUE will only return the list of attached Moto Mods which are fully functional and enumerated, Calling this function with FALSE will return the complete list of Moto Mods attached to the device.
        Parameters:
        onlineOnly - - true: return only attached Moto Mod; false: return all known Moto Mod
        Returns:
        The list of known Moto Mod
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • getModList

        public List getModList(int[] protocols,
              boolean onlineOnly)
                throws RemoteException
        Returns the list of attached Moto Mods. Calling this function with TRUE will only return the list of attached Moto Mods which are fully functional and enumerated, Calling this function with FALSE will return the complete list of Moto Mods attached to the device.
        Parameters:
        protocols - - This is an array of protocol IDs, it could be used as a filter, meaning only the ModDevice with these protocols will be returned. Use the constant value ModProtocol.PROTOCOL_ALL if you don't care the protocols. A null value will result null return
        onlineOnly - - true: return only attached Moto Mod; false: return all known Moto Mod
        Returns:
        The list of known Moto Mod
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • getDefaultModPackage

        public String getDefaultModPackage(ModDevice mod)
        Retrieves the default Android application associated with the currently attached Moto Mod, as read from the Moto Mod hardware manifest.
        Parameters:
        mod - - the Moto Mod device
        Returns:
        The default Android app

      • getConnectionsByDevice

        public List getConnectionsByDevice(ModDevice device)
                            throws RemoteException
        Retrieves all the connections associated with a given device. This requires the permission ModManager.PERMISSION_MOD_ACCESS_INFO.
        Parameters:
        device - - The device we are going to inquiry
        Returns:
        - Ths list of connections associated with the give device
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • requestUpdateFirmware

        public int requestUpdateFirmware(ModDevice device,
                        List locations)
                          throws RemoteException
        Request to update firmware for the device with the given firmware. Everytime, this api is called, ModManager will get consent from the user before proceeding with this request.

        This API will only work if a Moto Mod specifically allows unsecure flashing. This will only be functional for the Moto Mod developer kit and associated development board.

        Note this API is an aynchronous call, it will return immediately without waiting for the completion of the firmware update, caller of this API should listen on the broadcast intent ModManager.ACTION_MOD_FIRMWARE_UPDATE_DONE, and check the result via ModManager.EXTRA_RESULT_CODE.

        Parameters:
        device - - The Moto Mod device we are going to update firmware
        locations - - The location of the new firmwares, it's a list of firmware images
        Returns:
        - 0: request was successful. non-zero: request failed, we are using error code as defined in android.system.OsConstants
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • getModInterfaceDelegationsByProtocol

        public List getModInterfaceDelegationsByProtocol(ModDevice device,
                                        ModProtocol.Protocol protocol)
                                          throws RemoteException
        This function returns the list of ModInterfaceDelegation corresponding to the Linux devices on the Moto Mod that support a particular protocol. An application should use this to retrieve the device corresponding to the Raw device.
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • openModInterface

        public ParcelFileDescriptor openModInterface(ModInterfaceDelegation iface,
                                    int mode)
                                      throws RemoteException
        This function opens a file descriptor to access the given ModInterfaceDelegation. The caller of this function must have the ModManager.PERMISSION_USE_RAW_PROTOCOL permission if the device is a raw device. Otherwise this is protected by the ModManager.PERMISSION_MOD_INTERNAL which is only available to system appslications.
        Parameters:
        iface - - The instance of ModInterfaceDelegation to be opened
        mode - - Read/Write, refer to AOSP android.os.ParcelFileDescriptor
        Returns:
        - A file descriptor to that interface on Moto Mod device.
        Throws:
        RemoteException

      • getClassManager

        public final Object getClassManager(ModDevice device,
                     ModProtocol.Protocol protocol)
        Returns the handle to the class interface manager corresponding to the PROTOCOL, which the calling application could use to control the Moto Mod.

        Current available protocols are:

        Protocol Class Manager
        ModProtocol.Protocol.BATTERY ModBattery
        ModProtocol.Protocol.MODS_DISPLAY ModDisplay
        ModProtocol.Protocol.LIGHTS ModBacklight
        Parameters:
        device - The Moto Mod device that the class interface manager will operate on.
        protocol - The protocol of the desired class interface manager
        Returns:
        The class interface manager or null if it's not supported, or the device doesn't have that protocol declared

      • getClassManager

        public final Object getClassManager(ModDevice device,
                     Class serviceClass)
        Returns the handle to the individual class interface manager corresponding to the SERVICE CLASS, which the caller app could use to control the Moto Mod.

        Current available classes are: ModBattery, ModDisplay, ModBacklight

        Parameters:
        device - The Moto Mod device that the class interface manager will operate on.
        serviceClass - The class of the desired service
        Returns:
        The class interface manager or null if it's not supported, or the device doesn't have that protocol declared

      • getClassManager

        public final Object getClassManager(ModProtocol.Protocol protocol)
        A convenient version of #getClassManager(ModDevice, Protocol). It retrieves the current attached Moto Mod if and calls #getClassManager(ModDevice, Protocol) with the first Moto Mod device passed from ModManager.getModList(boolean).
        Parameters:
        protocol - The protocol of the desired class interface manager
        Returns:
        The class interface manager or null if it's not supported, or the device doesn't have that protocol declared

      • getClassManager

        public final Object getClassManager(Class serviceClass)
        A convenient version of ModManager.getClassManager(ModDevice, Class). It retrieves the current attached Moto Mod, and then calls ModManager.getClassManager(ModDevice, Class) with the first Moto Mod device we get from ModManager.getModList(boolean).
        Parameters:
        serviceClass - The class of the desired service
        Returns:
        The class interface manager or null if it's not supported, or the device doesn't have that protocol declared

      • isModServicesAvailable

        public static int isModServicesAvailable(Context context)
        Verifies that the Moto Mod service is installed and enabled on this device, and that the version installed on this device is compatible with the one required by this application (is not older than the one required by the calling application). This API should be used to determine whether the device your application is installed on supports Moto Mods or not.

        In order to specify which Moto Mod service version your App is building against, you will need:

            1. Copy the version.xml into your project's resource folder.
            2. In your AndroidManifest.xml, you need to add the following section:

         <meta-data android:name="com.motorola.mod.version"
      android:value="@integer/moto_mod_services_version" / >

        After that, in your code you should call this API to check the availability of this service in the target device.

        Returns:
        Status code indicating whether there was an error. Can be one of the following values: ModManager.SUCCESS, ModManager.SERVICE_MISSING, ModManager.SERVICE_UPDATING, ModManager.SERVICE_VERSION_UPDATE_REQUIRED, ModManager.SERVICE_DISABLED, ModManager.SERVICE_INVALID.

      • getModSdkVersion

        public static int getModSdkVersion(Context context)
        This function returns the SDK version supported by the ModService that is installed on the phone, independently of your device core Moto Mod Platform version. As the ModService is updatable with an APK, there is a possibility that the SDK version returned by the ModService is higher than the Moto Mod SDK version supported by the phone platform. For example, this will be the case if the user has installed a newer ModService on an older platform. An application should also call ModManager.getModPlatformSDKVersion() to get the platform supported SDK version.
        Parameters:
        context - Caller's context
        Returns:
        the version number of SDK of form XXYY

      • getModPlatformSDKVersion

        public static int getModPlatformSDKVersion()
        This function returns the SDK version supported by the Phone's core platform. As the ModService is updatable with an APK, there is a possibility that the SDK version supported by the ModService might be higher than the SDK version supported by the underlying device software platform. For example, this will be the case when the user has installed a newer ModService on an older platform. Some functions in the newer SDK might not be supported on the older platform. Please refer to the documentation of those APIs for more information. An application may also call ModManager.getModSdkVersion(Context) to get the SDK version supported by ModService.
        Returns:
        the version number of SDK of form XXYY

      • initSetupComplete

        public boolean initSetupComplete(ModDevice device)
                          throws RemoteException
        If the Moto Mod specifies a package name in its manifest file and if that package is installed on the smartphone, the ModManager will not display the initial setup screens, but will let the app handle it.
        Parameters:
        device - The Moto Mod device
        Returns:
        true if success , false otherwise
        Throws:
        RemoteException
